info.description: ## Extract E-Mail > Extract E-Mail from String ## Screenshot ## Install ``` $ pip install extractemail ``` ## Usage ```python import extractemail text = """ Yoginth is very productive person he has multiple emails like yoginth@zoho.com but he likes yoginth@gmail.com but the username has already taken, yoginth wants to get yoginth@gitlab.com but he want to work there. """ extractemail.extract(text) #=> ['yoginth@zoho.com', 'yoginth@gmail.com', 'yoginth@gitlab.com'] ``` ## Get Help There are few ways to get help: 1. Please [post questions on Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask). You can open issues with questions, as long you add a link to your Stack Overflow question. 2. For bug reports and feature requests, open issues. 3. For direct and quick help, you can [email me](mailto://yoginth@zoho.com). ## How to contribute Have an idea? Found a bug? info.name: extractemail
info.html_description:
Extract E-Mail

Extract E-Mail from String

Screenshot

Install

$ pip install extractemail

Usage

import extractemail

text = """
    Yoginth is very productive person he has multiple emails
    like yoginth@zoho.com but he likes yoginth@gmail.com
    but the username has already taken, yoginth wants to
    get yoginth@gitlab.com but he want to work there.
"""

extractemail.extract(text)
#=> ['yoginth@zoho.com', 'yoginth@gmail.com', 'yoginth@gitlab.com']

Get Help

There are few ways to get help:

  1. Please post questions on Stack Overflow. You can open issues with questions, as long you add a link to your Stack Overflow question.

  2. For bug reports and feature requests, open issues.

  3. For direct and quick help, you can email me.

How to contribute

Have an idea? Found a bug? See how to contribute.

Thanks!

License

MIT
